qas.question: What is the name of the newly renovated site where the bombing occured?

answers.text: Oklahoma City National Memorial and Museum

qas.question: What year did the memorial first opened?

context: Residents of Oklahoma City suffered substantial losses on April 19, 1995 when Timothy McVeigh detonated a bomb in front of the Murrah building. The building was destroyed (the remnants of which had to be imploded in a controlled demolition later that year), more than 100 nearby buildings suffered severe damage, and 168 people were killed. The site has been commemorated as the <a0_0>Oklahoma City National Memorial and Museum<a0_0/>. Since its opening in <a1_0>2000<a1_0/>, over three million people have visited. Every year on April 19, survivors, families and friends return to the memorial to read the names of each person lost.
